title: Director of Security
name: David Benoit
description: Provide enterprise security guidance, oversight, and security management to ensure compliance with the National Industrial Security Program Operating Manuals (NISPOM) and DoD Directives. Administer, manage, implement, and coordinate DoD and IC security programs at all Iridium geographically separated facilities. Plan and implement strategic security vision to ensure security compliance with government regulations and company policies and procedures. Provide security guidance to senior managers and employees regarding security regulations and procedures. Develop and implement security policies and procedures in coordination with government agencies and company management. Supervise subcontracted security personnel and manage security contracts. Develop and conduct security-related training programs. Maintain liaison with outside agencies.

title: Senior Program Security Officer & Team Lead
company: System High Corporation and ManTech SMA
name: David Benoit
description: Provided day-to-day SCI, SAP, and RESERVE (RSV) program security support, guidance and consultation to NRO Senior Leadership of the NRO, DoD, and CIA Special Communication’s Community. Managed and led contract support team providing multi-discipline program security support to the NRO’s Office of Security and Counter Intelligence and NRO’s Special Communication Office. Developed organizational security strategies, authored Program Protection Plans (PPP); prepared security test plans, composed Security Standard Operating Procedures, created and edited security classification guides along with other pertinent security documentation needed to identify, protect, and integrate Critical Program Information (CPI) throughout the acquisition life-cycle. Senior Security Manager for NRO's Special Communication Office, providing complete life-cycle security management to SCO programs.

title: Senior Security Manager
name: David Benoit
description: Managed, led, and supervised all disciplines of Program Security for the NRO’s AS&T Futures Lab (AFL). Developed Security Standard Operating Procedures for the AFL and provided program security oversight to the lab's multi-security networked, modeling, simulation, computing and visualization environment for the Intelligence Community and Department of Defense. Protected networked experiments and reviewed advance concepts of operations across dispersed operational environments.

title: Senior Security Manager
name: David Benoit
description: Managed, led, and supervised all facets of SCI and SAP Program Security for the NRO’s National Reconnaissance Office’s Operations Center (NROC). NRO's security lead for Operation Burnt Frost. Provided day-to-day program security advice and assistance to Senior NRO, NROC, and Office of Security and Counter Intelligence leadership in the areas of Physical, Information, Operational, Administrative, and Personnel Security for SCI, RSV, SAP, and IJSTO security programs. Developed and implemented program protection objectives; authored program protection plans; applied risk management security methodologies to assure life-cycle protection for IC and DoD SAP programs. Prepared SAPF compartmented checklists, system security plans, program access requests, and Tier 1 adjudicative reviews for NRO, DoD, and Joint Special Programs. Interpreted, studied, reviewed, and applied security requirements; NISPOM, NISPOM Supplement, DCID’s, JAFAN’s, and DoD “M-1” manual for Senior NRO leadership. Identified communications and network security risks and vulnerabilities to multi-security level networks and recommended risk managed security solutions to facilitate mission demands. Managed and led ManTech security team responsible for providing customer with first-class, “customer-focused”, and cost effective security solutions.

title: USAF Security Manager and Specialist
name: David Benoit
description: Managed, led, and supervised all aspects of program security for the NRO’s DDMS Directorate: Physical, Information, Technical, Personnel, Contract, COMSEC, AIS, and OPSEC. Responsible for the protection and application of several multimillion dollar classified programs. Led and supervised diverse team of 22 military, government, and contractor personnel providing SCI and collateral security oversight and support to 4500 employees at 27 worldwide locations. Actively managed the National Reconnaissance Office's, Office of Security’s, military customer support activities to include direct supervision of the NRO’s Special Security Office. Developed organizational security strategies and program protection policies; applied risk management methodologies to assure compliance and cost effective solutions to multiple demonstrations, experiments, and developmental activities throughout DDMS Labs. Interpreted, studied, reviewed, and applied security requirements; NISPOM, NISPOM Supplement, DCID’s, and DoD “M-1” manual for Senior IC and DoD leaders, industrial partners, and other national agencies. Inspired, motivated, and guided employees towards goal accomplishment. Established performance standards, appraised staff accomplishments, provided feedback, and rewarded or counseled as appropriate. Assigned, aligned, and reviewed subordinates goals to ensure they were parallel with organization’s vision, mission, and goals. Analyzed, prioritized, and adjusted tasks to meet mission demands and quality and quantity within set limits of time and cost.

description: - Analyzed and Disseminated intelligence products regarding insurgents, gov't officials, power brokers, and surrounding villages for Commander, Kandahar Air Field (COMKAF) and relevant HQ staff. - Delivered finalized intelligence products personally tailored to answer COMKAF's Priority Intelligence Requirements (PIRs), both verbally and written via numerous daily products to include: - Intelligence Summaries (INTSUMs) - Weekly “Look-back” Summaries - Verbal briefings - PPT slide decks - Provided historical and analytical context to threat reporting by way of commentary and analyses. - Supplied a clear and accurate picture of the battle space threats as identified by SIGINT and HUMINT collection efforts through frequent liaising with Air Force Office of Special Investigations and their state-side counterparts. - Developed in depth reporting and analysis of significant events that occur within the KAF Ground Defense Area (GDA), to enable COMKAF and higher HQ to stay fully appraised. - Managed the production of daily updated threat reports to maintain appropriate security levels and situation awareness of insurgent activity. - Analyzed INS attacks to identify enemy tactics, techniques, and procedures in order to aid targeting of insurgent networks. - Created target packages based on insurgent threats in the GDA in order to allow prosecution by Force Protection (FP) elements. - Generated route assessments within the GDA to support FP planning and movement. - Conducted detailed analysis in an effort to identify and understand insurgent lines of communication. - Produced threat assessments for KAF to identify potential threats in support of planning for protection of VIPs and large scale events occurring on base. - Developed Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) targets and provided Essential Elements of Information (EEIs) to develop Concepts of Operations, establish targets, exploit IDF attack sites and provide up to date imagery.

title: Director
company: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations, Afghanistan
name: COL John C. Hope

groups.name: Civil Affairs Alumni and current members-US military

education.name: United States Military Academy at West Point

description: Director, TFBSO Afghanistan, oversees all operations for the Director (SES) TFBSO, Washington, DC. Leads, directs, and is responsible for the management, administration, and delivery of all products and services in order to assure they are accomplished in an effective and efficient manner and within all policy, procedural and DoD guidelines. Responsible for helping to stimulate the private sector of the Afghanistan economy through direct foreign investment, support of business creation and growth, and training of entrepreneurs and business managers. Main areas of emphasis include: Investments, Extractives, Indigenous Industries and unique Governmental initiatives as identified. TFBSO provides key mentorship to Government ministries to influence programs and projects key for revenue generation. Provides advice and support to the Director, TFSBO in Washington, DC, and ensures he has accurate and timely information to make effective decisions. Interfaces, collaborates, and maintains working relationships with ISAF, Department of State, USAID, Department of Commerce and the Combined Security Transition Team - Afghanistan (CSTC-A). Maintains strict confidentiality in performing duties and maintains standards of conduct. Is respectful, possess cultural awareness and sensitivity, and demonstrates sound work ethics. Execute other duties and responsibilities as identified.

name: COL John C. Hope

groups.name: Civil Affairs Alumni and current members-US military

education.name: United States Military Academy at West Point

description: U.S. Army Reserve Representative to the Chief of Staff of the Army Strategic Studies Group Fellowship. Serves as one of twenty-nine fellows, personally selected by the Chief of Staff of the Army to serve on his Strategic Studies Group. Conducts independent research, analysis, and product development expressly focused on generating innovative concepts for land forces in support of a governing theme approved by the CSA. Interacts routinely with senior Army leaders and staff, leverages subject matter experts and innovators throughout industry, academia, DoD and the U.S. government. Attends and participates in meetings, exercises, and events in support of SSG goals and objectives. Provides recommendations to the CSA to prepare the Army to meet its long term challenges. Executes other duties as assigned.
